verses.verse: He leads counselors away plundered, And makes fools of the judges.
He loosens the bonds of kings, And binds their waist with a belt.
He leads princes away plundered, And overthrows the mighty.
(Job 32:9) He deprives the trusted ones of speech, And takes away the discernment of the elders.
((Job 34:19); Ps. 107:40; (Dan. 2:21)) He pours contempt on princes, And disarms the mighty.
He (Dan. 2:22; (1 Cor. 4:5)) uncovers deep things out of darkness, And brings the shadow of death to light.
(Is. 9:3; 26:15) He makes nations great, and destroys them; He enlarges nations, and guides them.
He takes away the understanding of the chiefs of the people of the earth, And (Ps. 107:4) makes them wander in a pathless wilderness.
(Job 5:14; 15:30; 18:18) They grope in the dark without light, And He makes them (Ps. 107:27) stagger like a drunken man.
“Behold, my eye has seen all this, My ear has heard and understood it.
(Job 12:3) What you know, I also know; I am not inferior to you.
(Job 23:3; 31:35) But I would speak to the Almighty, And I desire to reason with God.
But you forgers of lies, (Job 6:21; (Jer. 23:32)) You are all worthless physicians.
Oh, that you would be silent, And (Job 13:13; 21:5; Prov. 17:28) it would be your wisdom!
Now hear my reasoning, And heed the pleadings of my lips.
(Job 27:4; 36:4) Will you speak wickedly for God, And talk deceitfully for Him?
Will you show partiality for Him? Will you contend for God?
Will it be well when He searches you out? Or can you mock Him as one mocks a man?
He will surely rebuke you If you secretly show partiality.
Will not His excellence make you afraid, And the dread of Him fall upon you?
Your platitudes are proverbs of ashes, Your defenses are defenses of clay.
“Hold your peace with me, and let me speak, Then let come on me what may!
Why (Job 18:4) do I take my flesh in my teeth, And put my life in my hands?
(Ps. 23:4; (Prov. 14:32)) Though He slay me, yet will I trust Him. (Job 27:5) Even so, I will defend my own ways before Him.
He also shall be my salvation, For a (Job 8:13) hypocrite could not come before Him.
Listen carefully to my speech, And to my declaration with your ears.
See now, I have prepared my case, I know that I shall be ((Rom. 8:34)) vindicated.
(Job 7:21; 10:8; Is. 50:8) Who is he who will contend with me? If now I hold my tongue, I perish.
